Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery wine-jar, interior and exterior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text, one line of cord-marked decoration is visible on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393100) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393100)
